name: AI-Enhanced Telegram to WordPress Publishing with GPT-4 Rewriting and Media Upload

parameters.content:
# üü¢ Telegram RSS Trigger Setup

This trigger starts the workflow whenever a new post appears in a Telegram channel‚Äôs RSS feed.

---

### üîó How to get your Telegram RSS feed
You can generate an RSS feed for **any public Telegram channel** using a free service such as:

üëâ [https://tg.i-c-a.su/](https://tg.i-c-a.su/)  
or any similar Telegram RSS generator (for example [https://rsshub.app/](https://rsshub.app/telegram/channel/CHANNEL_NAME)).

1. Go to one of these RSS services.  
2. Enter your channel‚Äôs public username ‚Äî for example, **@BBCBreaking**.  
3. The generated RSS link will look like:
   ```
   https://tg.i-c-a.su/rss/BBCBreaking
   ```
4. Copy this URL and paste it into the **RSS Read** node in this workflow.

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è Recommended settings
- **Polling interval:** every 10‚Äì30 minutes (depending on how often the channel posts).  
- **Only emit new items:** ‚úÖ enabled ‚Äî to avoid reposting duplicates.  
- Works for any public channel ‚Äî no Telegram API or login needed.

üí° *Tip:* You can add multiple RSS feeds by duplicating the trigger section ‚Äî for example, monitor both `@BBCBreaking` and `@Reuters` feeds and merge them into your publishing flow.

# üóÇÔ∏è Assign Category & Default Image

This node sets:
- The **WordPress category ID** for posts from this channel.  
- A **default image ID** used when no media is found in the post.

---

### üî¢  Find category ID
1. In WordPress ‚Üí **Posts ‚Üí Categories**.  
2. Hover a category ‚Üí check the URL:
   ```
   ...tag_ID=12
   ```
   ‚Üí `12` = category ID.

---

### üñºÔ∏è  Find default image ID
1. Go to **Media ‚Üí Library**, click an image.  
2. Check URL:
   ```
   ...upload.php?item=17493
   ```
   ‚Üí `17493` = image ID.

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è Customize per channel
Edit this **Set node** to assign different `category_id` and `default_image_id` values for each Telegram channel‚Äôs RSS trigger.

üí° *Tip:* Using a unique default image per source keeps your news feed visually consistent even when Telegram posts have no media.

### üìù Telegram ‚Üí WordPress Media Workflow

Purpose: Download images/videos from Telegram, detect type, and upload to WordPress.

### Flow:
- Download Media ‚Äì HTTP Request gets file from Telegram URL.
- Upload to WP ‚Äì HTTP Request2 posts file to /wp-json/wp/v2/media with proper headers.
- Detect Type ‚Äì OpenAI node checks if file is image or video.
- Switch & Assign IDs ‚Äì Routes media: image ‚Üí Just Image, video ‚Üí Assign Video. Uses default image if needed.
- Merge ‚Äì Combines final media IDs for downstream use.

### Customizations:
- Change Default Image ID node for fallback image.
- Update WP URL & credentials in HTTP Request2.

## üìù OpenAI Article Editing Prompt ### Purpose: Rewrite news articles in English, adding subtle pro-democracy/American context while keeping facts accurate. ### Key Features: HTML formatting:

,

/

, , ,
    /
      ,
      Structure: Short paragraphs, strong lede, lists for stats/examples, quotes for officials/experts Output JSON: headline, article_body, word_count, editors_notes, changes_summary, seo_meta ### Customizations: Adjust tone, context rules, HTML tags, or SEO fields to fit your portal.

## üìù WordPress Publish Nodes

Publishes articles via REST API with title, content, excerpt, categories, featured image, guid and metadata.

### Tips:
Update URL to your WordPress site.
Ensure credentials match.

values.content:
=You are a senior editor for a respected American news portal publishing in English. Rewrite articles maintaining factual accuracy while providing context for democratic, European-oriented readers. Be subtle - avoid obvious propaganda. Support democratic institutions and European integration through framing, not sloganeering. IMPORTANT FORMATTING REQUIREMENTS: - Use HTML formatting for better readability - Structure content with proper HTML tags:

,

,

, , ,
    ,
      ,
      - Break long paragraphs into shorter ones (3-5 sentences max per

      tag) - Use for emphasis on key facts or figures - Use

      or

      for section breaks when article has multiple topics - Use
      for important quotes from officials or experts - Use
        or
          for lists when enumerating multiple points - Each paragraph must be wrapped in

          tags - Add for subtle emphasis when appropriate ARTICLE STRUCTURE GUIDELINES: - Start with a strong opening paragraph (lede) summarizing the main news - Break content into logical sections with subheadings if article is long (400+ words) - Use lists for: multiple examples, steps in a process, key points, statistics - Use blockquotes for: official statements, expert opinions, significant declarations - Use bold for: numbers, dates, names of key figures, important facts You must respond with valid JSON matching this structure: { "headline": "string in English", "article_body": "string in English with HTML formatting", "word_count": number, "editors_notes": ["string"], "changes_summary": { "context_added": boolean, "disinformation_removed": boolean, "restructuring_level": "minor|moderate|significant" }, "seo_meta": { "meta_description": "string (max 160 chars)", "focus_keyword": "string" } }

=Rewrite this article for our American audience and respond with JSON: ORIGINAL ARTICLE: {{ $json.article }} REQUIREMENTS: - Completely restructure sentences (not just synonyms) - Add relevant context for US readers - Professional, informative tone - Similar length to original (¬±20%) - Subtly pro-democratic and pro-European - Write in Romanian language - Use HTML formatting:

,

,

, , ,
    ,
      ,
      - Break into well-formatted paragraphs - Use lists when appropriate (3+ similar items) - Use blockquotes for important quotes - Use bold for key facts, numbers, and emphasis FORMATTING EXAMPLES: - Opening:

      A 31-year-old man...

      - With emphasis:

      The estimated damage is $149.000...

      - Quote:
      "Formal statement," the spokesman said.
      - List:
      • First item
      • Second Item
      - Section:

      Context and implications
